data.meta_description: This is the Order of David Gerrold Books in both chronological order and publication order. List verified daily and newest books added immediately.
data.text:
David Gerrold is an American author and screenwriter. He is best known for writing science fiction books and series. Gerrold was also the screenwriter of the Star Trek episode, “The Trouble with Tribbles.”

Some also know David as the writer who created the Sleestak race on the classic TV series Land of the Lost. As an author, he won the Hugo and Nebula awards for his novelette, The Martian Child, which was later turned into a film starring John Cusack. David was born in Chicago, but his family made their way to California where he graduated from Los Angeles Valley College, and San Fernando Valley State College.

Hella is a book about a planet, Hella, where everything is oversized. The trees are miles high with huge herds of dinosaurs and extreme weather. The colonists who have come here need to hibernate twice per year to escape the blistering heat of summer and the freezing cold of winter. Kyle is a neuro-atypical young man, emotionally challenged, who has an implant in head head that give him access to the colony’s computer network. He gets notice that an overburdened starship is on their way, and that he’ll need to be the link between the colonists and the refugees. However, the colony is barely self-sufficient and could struggle with all the new arrivals. Kyle finds himself in the middle of it all as he’ll need to guide the colony away from disaster.

Under the Eye of God is the first book in the Trackers series of books. The story follows a race of genetically engineered killing machines known as the Phaestor and their army of deadly Moktar Dragons. They were once considered to be humanity’s only hope for survival, but that was a long time ago. They vanquished their enemy and have now become the enemy as they have seized control of the galaxy.
